content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"^```julia\n([\s\S]+?)\n```$"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    extracted_code = ""

    # Loop through each match of the regular expression
    for m in eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)
        # Get the content of the code block
        content = m.captures[1]

        # Remove the leading and trailing newlines from the content
        content = strip(content)

        # Append the content to the extracted code
        extracted_code *= "\n" * content * "\n"
    end

    return extracted_code
end
```

This function `extract_julia_code` takes a string `md` containing Markdown with Julia language code blocks and returns a string with all the code blocks removed from the markdown and concatenated together with newlines in between.
